meanings.definition: In a way that shows a readiness to listen or observe carefully.
meanings.sent1: She listened attentively to the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: He watched the magic trick attentively, trying to figure out the secret.
meanings.sent3: The detective attentively studied the crime scene, looking for clues.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden bloomed attentively, as if aware of the beauty they brought.
meanings.sent5: The old man's eyes sparkled attentively as he recounted his adventures.

meanings.definition: In a way that shows a willingness to pay close attention.
meanings.sent1: The student worked attentively on his homework, determined to get good grades.
meanings.sent2: The chef cooked attentively, ensuring each dish was perfect.
meanings.sent3: The cat watched attentively as the mouse scurried across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The stars twinkled attentively in the night sky, as if whispering secrets to each other.
meanings.sent5: The audience clapped attentively, appreciating the performance.
